00020 
00021 // Pick up any platform-specific definitions for the common
00022 // macros.
00023 #include "osclconfig.h"
00024 
00025 // Define default values for the common macros
00026 #ifndef OSCL_EXPORT_REF
00027 #define OSCL_EXPORT_REF
00028 #endif
00029 
00030 #ifndef OSCL_IMPORT_REF
00031 #define OSCL_IMPORT_REF
00032 #endif
00033 
00035 //static const char NULL_TERM_CHAR = '\0';
00036 #ifndef NULL_TERM_CHAR

00038 #endif
00039 
00041 #ifndef NULL
00042 #define NULL (0)
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #if (OSCL_DISABLE_INLINES)
00046 #define OSCL_INLINE
00047 #define OSCL_COND_EXPORT_REF OSCL_EXPORT_REF
00048 #define OSCL_COND_IMPORT_REF OSCL_IMPORT_REF
00049 #else
00050 #define OSCL_INLINE inline
00051 #define OSCL_COND_EXPORT_REF
00052 #define OSCL_COND_IMPORT_REF
00053 #endif

00055 //this macro may not be defined in all configurations
00056 //so a default is defined here.
00057

00064 #define OSCL_CONST_CAST(type,exp)           ((type)(exp))
00065 #define OSCL_STATIC_CAST(type,exp)          ((type)(exp))
00066 #define OSCL_REINTERPRET_CAST(type,exp)     ((type)(exp))
00067 #define OSCL_DYNAMIC_CAST(type, exp)        ((type)(exp))
00068 
00069 
00084 #define OSCL_UNUSED_ARG(vbl) (void)(vbl)
00085 #define OSCL_UNUSED_RETURN(value) return value
00086 
00087 /* The __TFS__ macro is used to optionally expand to "<>" depending on the
00088  * compiler.  Some compilers require it to indicate that the friend function
00089  * is a template function as specified in the standard, but others don't
00090  * like it so it will handled with a macro expansion that depends on the
00091  * compiler.
00092  */
00093 #ifndef __TFS__
00094 #define __TFS__
00095 #endif
00096 
00097 #define OSCL_MIN(a,b) ((a) < (b) ? (a) : (b))
00098 #define OSCL_MAX(a,b) ((a) > (b) ? (a) : (b))
00099 #define OSCL_ABS(a) ((a) > (0) ? (a) : -(a))
00100 
00101 // the syntax for explicitly calling the destructor varies on some platforms
00102 // below is the default syntax as defined in the C++ standard
00103 #ifndef OSCL_TEMPLATED_DESTRUCTOR_CALL
00104 #define OSCL_TEMPLATED_DESTRUCTOR_CALL(type,simple_type) type :: ~simple_type ()
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 
00108 /*
00109  * The OSCL_UNSIGNED_CONST macro is used to optionally add a suffix to the
00110  * end of integer constants to identify them as unsigned constants.  It is
00111  * usually only necessary to do that for very large constants that are too
00112  * big to fit within the range of a signed integer. Some compilers will issue
00113  * warnings for that.  The default behavior will be to add no suffix.
00114  */
00115 
00116 #ifndef OSCL_UNSIGNED_CONST
00117 #define OSCL_UNSIGNED_CONST(x) x
00118 #endif
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * These macros are used by MTP to avoid byte aligning structures.
00122  */
00123 #ifndef OSCL_PACKED_VAR
00124 #define OSCL_PACKED_VAR         "error"
00125 #endif
00126 
00127 #ifndef OSCL_BEGIN_PACKED
00128 #define OSCL_BEGIN_PACKED       "error"
00129 #endif
00130 
00131 #ifndef OSCL_END_PACKED
00132 #define OSCL_END_PACKED         "error"
00133 #endif
00134 
00137 #endif  // OSCL_BASE_MACROS_H_INCLUDED
